title: 109_hr4716
content: The Act titled "Home and Farm Wind Energy Systems Act of 2006" provides a credit for wind energy property installed in residences and businesses under section 30E of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Home and Farm Wind Energy Systems Act of 2006" offers a tax credit for qualified wind energy property, allowing a 30% credit for property placed in service or installed during the taxable year. To qualify, at least 50% of the energy produced annually must be consumed on-site. Qualified wind energy property includes qualifying wind turbines placed in service in the United States. The "Home and Farm Wind Energy Systems Act of 2006" provides a tax credit for qualified wind energy property, with specific requirements for turbines installed in the United States. A qualifying wind turbine must have a 5-year warranty and meet performance standards to generate electricity. The tax credit for qualified wind energy property is subject to limitations based on the amount of tax. The credit allowed for any taxable year cannot exceed the regular tax liability plus the tax imposed by section 55, minus the sum of other allowable credits. Any excess credit can be carried over to the following year. The tax credit for qualified wind energy property can be carried over to the following year if it exceeds the allowable credit for the current year. Special rules apply for tenant-stockholders in cooperative housing corporations and individuals in condominiums. Individuals who are members of a condominium management association owning a condominium can be credited for their share of expenses on qualified wind energy property. The association must meet specific requirements for the credit to be allocated to the individual. Individuals can receive a credit for expenses on qualified wind energy property used as residences. The basis of the property is reduced by the amount of the credit allowed. The credit applies to property placed in service after December 31, 2005. The credit for qualified wind energy property used as residences is allowed under section 30E, with a reduction in the property's basis. The credit applies to property placed in service after December 31, 2005. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart B of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Code. The amendments made by section 30E for wind energy property will apply to taxable years ending after December 31, 2005.
